pageContext.claim: “In the twisted world view of the Washington, very sick Democrats, it was totally fine when crooked Hillary Clinton ran her outrageous pay-for-play schemes out of the State Department.”
pageContext.analysis: There is no evidence that Clinton ran "pay-for-play schemes" when she was Secretary of State. Trump in the past has pointed to a deal involving a company called Uranium One, but that's a Four-Pinocchio claim. The State Department was one of nine agencies on a committee that approved the sale of majority of shares of the uranium mining company to the Russians. The Nuclear Regulatory Commission also separately approved the deal. There's no evidence Clinton got involved in the deal personally, and it's highly questionable this deal even rose to the level of the secretary of state.
